description.narrative: Activities related to the COVID-19 responses to be covered by the SDG Fund project.

participating-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

description.narrative: 3.1. Relevant communication strategies, guiding policy documents and protocols, are elaborated to better respond to the needs of PwDs amidst the pandemic. 3.3.1 Number of guidelines/protocols on treating PwDs on COVID-19 Number of people reached through Videos and printing materials on COVID-19

comment.narrative:
No mechanisms, protocols, communication strategies and mitigation measures are in place.
No guidelines/protocols on place to treat PwDs during global pandemic
No informational materials on COVID-19 on place

1.1. Support in drafting the regulations on access to information to PwDs. Support implementation of the law on PwDs 1.2. Provide support to PDO to monitor the implementation of CRPD 1.3. In collaboration with LSGs (in selected municipalities) establish 2 community centers for PwDs combining day-care, socialization and entrepreneurial activities, and ensuring economic sustainability of the created entities. 2.2. Support LSGs in introduction of social services to PwDs. TOT on universal design. Cooperate with selected HEIs to incorporate principles of universal design in their curricula

1.1. In cooperation with the Parliament of Georgia, UNDP elaborated the Guideline on Web-Accessibility for People with Disabilities in Georgia. To support implementation of LRPD UNDP held a working meeting with the participation of representatives from Parliament, Government’s Administration, line ministries and other state agencies. Conducted trainings for up to 100 representatives of the General Prosecutor’s Office and the Ministry of Finance on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Supporting the Ministry of Internal Affairs to upgrade training modules and conducting the ToT on psychological aspects and communication standards with PwDs for the Academy of Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgia 1.2. Supporting the Office of Public Defender of Georgia to perform its functions as a National Monitoring Mechanism of the CRPD. Among other activities, together with the PDO, UNDP conducted the assessment of State Social Rehabilitation Programmes for Persons with disabilities and the monitoring of provision of mental health services during COVID-19. 1.3. The Social Inclusion Center in Ambrolauri was established. The main function of the Center is provision of space for social activities and professional skills development for PwDs. 2.2. Supported strengthening Social Services for PwDs in Akhaltshikhe and Shuakhevi municipalities. The national expert elaborated guideline on providing social services and conducted trainings on delivery of rehabilitation services for up to 100 representatives of local self-government bodies of selected Municipalities. In order to support the implementation of the standards UNDP conduced series of trainings for up to 300 personnel of architecture, infrastructure, supervision and urban development unites of municipalities of Georgia. Module on Accessibility standards was elaborated for the HEIs. UNDP works with them to incorporate in their study curricula.

1.1. Support development of the Chapter Rights of Persons with Disabilities of the National Human Rights Strategy. Support incorporation of universal design principles in regulations on construction and urban planning to ensure accessibility. 1.2. Capacity building of DPOs/NGOs in grant implementation 1.3. Cooperate with selected employers (private and public sector organizations) to implement reasonable accommodation principles in the workplace. In collaboration with LSGs (in selected municipalities) establish 2 community centers for PwDs combining day-care, socialization and entrepreneurial activities, and ensuring economic sustainability of the created entities. Capacity building of employment coaches under the Social Service Agency. 3.1. Information on pandemic is accessible for PwDs; 3.3.1. Medical institutions are provided with guidelines/protocols on how to treat PwDs during COVID-19; All the information on COVID-19 is accessible for PwDs

1.1. National Human Rights Strategy, with respective priority on the rights of PwDs is drafted and awaits approval. National accessibility standards were elaborated and adopted. 1.2. Built the capacity of OPDs, and NGOs working on the rights of PwDs in the regions of Georgia on the issues of grant proposal writing, project management and reporting. In total, representatives of 18 organizations underwent the training. 1.3. As a result of productive and efficient negotiation process with private sector organizations in order to implement reasonable accommodation principles in the services and infrastructure of private companies. trainings on service provision to PwDs was conducted for two pharmaceutical companies. Elaborated the concept of Social Inclusion Centers. Supported the State Employment Agency to review and improve the job description of job coaches for PwDs. Build the capacity of job coaches in the main principals of job coaching for PwDs and communication methods with persons with different types of disabilities. 3.1. UNDP worked hand in hand with the Government of Georgia to ensure that persons with disabilities all over the country have full access to accurate and timely information to protect themselves from the COVID-19 pandemic; UNDP supported the Government in providing sign language translation for all televised briefings on COVID-19; UNDP in partnership with the Administration of the Georgian Government produced the video guide for the persons with disabilities. It was shared far and wide by TV and social media channels with 147,341 reach and 2,186 engagement on Facebook; 3.3.1. With UNDP support, Georgia’s Ministry of Health prepared and adopted the guidelines and protocols for mental healthcare providers, aiming to protect their patients and personnel from the virus; With UNDP support guidance on hospice and palliative care during the pandemic was issued
